metadata.title: CVE-2021-0920 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
In unix_scm_to_skb of af_unix.c, there is a possible use after free bug dueto a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege withSystem execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-196926917References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-0920` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-lowlatency - 4.4.0-223.256
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-159-generic - 4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-159-generic - 4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-159-lowlatency - 4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-kvm - 4.4.0-1104.113
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-aws - 4.4.0-1139.153
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1112-aws - 4.15.0-1112.119~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1124-azure - 4.15.0-1124.137~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1109-gcp - 4.15.0-1109.123~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1081-oracle - 4.15.0-1081.89~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-223.256').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.113').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.153').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1112.119~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1124.137~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1109.123~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1081.89~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
